pr_title: Settles a service bus message. Allows receiving in both PEEK_LOCK and RECEIVE_AND_DELETE.

timeline.bodyText:
Any reason why bring back hardcoded value and not using variable senderSettleMode  and receiverSettleMode ?
Later in configureSender() and configureReceiver() these values are hardcoded.
Shouldn't this use provided values ?
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

replies.bodyText: I can pass these later. My original design was that these could be overridden in an extending class. I'll revert this.
replies.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: That design is good. Thanks for letting me know.
replies.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText: MessagingEntityType.QUEUE  Is there a need to know the type ? We will not always know for example if user uses connectionString(String connectionStringWithResourceName) in Builder.
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

replies.bodyText: Yes. We do when building the receiver itself. On management operations, they specify what the entity type is before sending the message (in the headers).
replies.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: We do not know always what is the entity type.
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

replies.bodyText: We do, a management node is tied to an entity path, which is tied to a specific entity.
replies.author: conniey

replies.bodyText:
Just want to clarify that user specify "EntityName" and it could be Queue or Topic. So when user provide EntityName connectionString, we will not know is it topic or queue. User can send to a Topic/Queue without knowing what is  EntityType.
But you said you are going to infer it, same way  it is done in track1, and that is fine .
replies.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText: Do you have test when user do not want autoComplete and  want to call him self ?
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText: Would we expect anyone to modify the return list? I believe Collections.singletonList returns an immutable list.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Does this need to return a Boolean? It doesn't appear to be used by the caller, we just default into a then.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Oh yes. Thanks for pointing that out. If it is false, it should just return.
replies.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Interesting that this returns false instead of throwing an exception and that the lock token being invalid throws an exception.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Any reason this is called Mono when it is a Flux?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.message:
Not tying a connection to a single entityPath. (This is specific to Event Hubs.)Not tying a connection to a single entitytPath. (This is specific to Event Hubs.)

Update Interface to accept multiple messaging entities.

Add reactor receiver for service bus.

Add serialization for list.

Adding MessageWithLockToken

Move deserialization and publish logic to elastic.

Add implementation for other settlement statuses.
